other

Class Question

  • java.lang.Object
    • other.Question

  • public class Question
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a question from the database with four answers, one of which is correct and three of which are incorrect

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Question(java.lang.String question, java.lang.String correct, java.lang.String wrong1, java.lang.String wrong2, java.lang.String wrong3)
      Creates a new Question object with the following parameters

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.lang.String getWrong2() 
      java.lang.String getWrong3()

      Sets the correct answer to a new one as text
      void setQuestion(java.lang.String question)
      Sets the actual question
      void setWrong1(java.lang.String wrong1)
      Sets the first incorrect answer to a new one as text
      void setWrong2(java.lang.String wrong2)
      Sets the second incorrect answer to a new one as text
      void setWrong3(java.lang.String wrong3)
      Sets the third incorrect answer to a new one as text
      java.lang.String toString()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Question

        public Question(java.lang.String question,
                java.lang.String correct,
                java.lang.String wrong1,
                java.lang.String wrong2,
                java.lang.String wrong3)
        Creates a new Question object with the following parameters
        Parameters:
        question - the text that is the actual question
        correct - the correct answer
        wrong1 - one of the three incorrect answers
        wrong2 - the second of the three incorrect answers
        wrong3 - the third (and last) of the three incorrect answers

    • Method Detail

        Returns:
        the actual question as text

        Parameters:
        question - the new question as text

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • getWrong1

        public java.lang.String getWrong1()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        this Question object as text, showing the actual question followed by the correct answer and then the three incorrect answers.
